speaker: Holmes
transcript: Lord Alistair, thank you for clarifying. You were in your study from 9 PM until midnight.

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: Yes, precisely. I was working on my memoirs. I... I never left the room.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: A tedious task, I'm sure. Memoirs.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: It's curious, the housemaid mentioned you took no tea, no brandy... nothing.

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: I was engrossed. I simply... forgot. The work was all-consuming.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: So it would seem. (pause) The floor in your study is mahogany, is it not?

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: ...Yes. French mahogany.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: And the hall, a fine Italian marble. Splendid. Though terribly cold on the feet, I find.

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: I... suppose it is.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: The housemaid also found it necessary to re-wax a small, scuffed portion of the marble *by the east-wing door*.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: She presumed it was from a servant's boot. But the scuff was so... small. Almost delicate.

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: A servant. No doubt. They are so clumsy.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: Indeed. (pause) You play billiards, my Lord?

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: I... what? No. I haven't played in years.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: A pity. I find the chalk... that little blue cube... to be a fascinating substance.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: So very, very fine. It gets *everywhere*. And it is almost identical in colour...

speaker: Holmes
transcript: ...to the dust from the binding of your stolen attestation.

speaker: Lord Alistair
transcript: That's... that's absurd.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: Is it? Then you won't mind my asking Dr. Watson to inspect your slippers.

speaker: Holmes
transcript: That will be all. Thank you for your time.
